ul.li:
Get Work Items
Get, create, delete, search and update bugs, tasks, and other work items for your team.

Builds Management
Provides methods for the build management.

p.p: The plugin allows to integrate Electic Flow with both Azure DevOps Server (TFS) and the Azure DevOps Services (VSTS).

Azure DevOps Services is a cloud service for collaborating on code development. It provides an integrated set of features that you access through your web browser or IDE client, including the following:

ul.li: Git repositories for source control of your code
Build and release services to support continuous integration and delivery of your apps
Agile tools to support planning and tracking your work, code defects, and issues using Kanban and Scrum methods
A variety of tools to test your apps, including manual/exploratory testing, load testing, and continuous testing
Highly customizable dashboards for sharing progress and trends
Built-in wiki for sharing information with your team.

p.p: Previously known as Team Foundation Server (TFS), Azure DevOps Server is a set of collaborative software development tools, hosted on-premises. Azure DevOps Server integrates with your existing IDE or editor, enabling your cross-functional team to work effectively on projects of all sizes.
For more information about AzureDevOps, go to:

The EC-AzureDevOps-Training plugin allows users to manage the Work Items, queue Builds and configure automations regarding on the build status.
There's also a separate Electric Flow CE extension at the Azure Marketplace for the reverse management.

div.p:
The following versions are supported:
AzureDevOps Server/Services ( API version - 4.1 )
TFS Server 2017 Update 2
div.div:
Plugin Configurations
Plugin configurations are sets of parameters that apply across some or all of the plugin procedures. They reduce repetition of common values, create predefined parameter sets for end users, and securely store credentials where needed. Each configuration is given a unique name that is entered in designated parameters on procedures that use them.
Creating Plugin Configurations
To create plugin configurations in ElectricFlow, do these steps:
Go to Administration > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Find the @PLUGIN_NAME@ row.
Click Configure to open the Configurations page.
Click Create Configuration.
Important
AzureDevOps Services and some of the TFS Servers (default depends of the version), does not accept clear password for the Basic authentication method. You should create a Personal Access Token (PAT) and use it instead of a password.
Custom API Version should be specified only if you are using TFS and your version is not listed.
Configuration Parameters
Parameter Description
Configuration Unique name for the plugin configuration.
Description Description for the plugin configuration.
AzureDevOps Server/Services Endpoint AzureDevOps endpoint (https://dev.azure.com) or TFS server (scheme://server:port/tfs) URL.
Collection/Organization Name Collection name for TFS or Organization name for AzureDevOps. If not defined, DefaultCollection will be used. (which is applicable only for the TFS server)
Auth Type Select the type of authentication to use. Note: Some endpoints acceps only PAT for Basic Authentication.
Credentials Username and password/PAT to connect to AzureDevOps Server/Services.
Check Connection? If checked, the credentials will be checked before the configuration is saved.
API Version TFS and AzureDevOps Server/Services requires version to be specified.
Custom API Versions Versions for different APIs, one version per line. API names can look like wit/workitems, wit/wiql, git/repositories - generally, part of the API endpoint after the _apis part. If no version is provided, version 1.0 will be used.
Log Level This option sets debug level for logs. If info is selected, only summary infornation will be show, for debug, there will be some debug information and for trace the whole requests and responses will be shown.
HTTP Proxy A proxy that should be used for connections.
Proxy Authorization Username and password for proxy.

p.p: IMPORTANT For all parameter descriptions in this section, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

div.p: Creates one or multiple new work items.
List of the predefined work item types can be changed in the plugin properties (Commander > Administration > Plugins > @PLUGIN_NAME@ > Properties tab > ecp_azuredevops_workitemtypes ).

tr.td: Short description of the work item.
Name or ID of a team project where the work item should be created.
Name of the work item type.
Priority for completing the work item, based on business goals. Parameter should contain a number
The person currently assigned to the work item. The value can contain an email or a fully specified name of an assignee

This property should contain JSON array with the work items to create. All missing fields will be read from usual parameters.
Example: [{"Title": "Title for the first work item", "Type": "Task"}, {"Title": "Title for the second work item", "Priority": 2}]
Additional fields to be added as a JSON array. This an advanced usage field, please refer to the "Usage Example" at the procedure's help or the Azure DevOps documentation for the examples.
Format to save the request results.
Results will be saved into this property/property sheet. Property 'workItemIds' under the result property sheet will contain IDs for the created work items.

div.p: Queries work items and saves them under the specified property. Only the fields specified in a query will be retrieved.

tr.td: Filter the results to this team project. If your query string uses the @project macro (e.g. '[System.TeamProject] = @project'), you must specify the project.
ID of the existing query. Either this or Query Text should be specified.
Query string in WIQL. Either this or Query ID should be specified.
If checked, time precision (HH:MM:SS) is allowed in the date time comparisons.
Format to save the request results.
Results will be saved into this property/property sheet.

div.p: Retrieves a list of the work items by the specified IDs.

The procedure allows you to receive all the fields (or the specified ones only) for the work items with the specified ids.
You can also specify As of (date) parameter as a UTC date time string (2019-01-15T13:45:30) to get all work items as they existed at that time.

tr.td: A comma-separated list of up to 200 IDs of the work items to get.

Request only the fields specified in a list (comma-separated, up to 100) for a work item. If not specified, all fields with values are returned.
Example: 'System.State, System.IterationPath, Microsoft.VSTS.Common.StateChangeDate, Microsoft.VSTS.Common.Priority'.
Refer to the https://dev.azure.com/{yourOrganizationName}/_apis/wit/fields to see all of the available fields. This parameter cannot be specified with the "Expand Relationships".
UTC date time string (2019-01-15T13:45:30). Gets the work items as they existed at this time.

Gets work item relationships (work item links, hyperlinks, file attachements, etc.). This parameter cannot be specified with the "Only Fields".
Some of the types are not supported by the older TFS API.
Results will be saved into this property/property sheet.
Format to save the request results.

p.p: Work Item ID(s) field here refers the result of the CreateWorkItems procedure, you can use the comma-separated numeric values instead.

div.p: Updates field values for the work items with the specified ids.
You can add the comment for the work item by specifying the "Comment Body" parameter.

tr.td: ID(s) of the work items to be updated.
New title for the work item.
New priority for completing the work item, based on business goals. This field should contain a number.
Change the person currently assigned to the work item. The value can contain an email or a fully specified name of an assignee.
New description for the work item.
Comment with given text will be added to the work item.
Additional fields to be added as a JSON array. This an advanced usage field, please refer to the "Usage Example" at the procedure's help or the Azure DevOps documentation for the examples.
Format to save the request results.
Updated items will be saved into this property/property sheet.

p.p: Work Item ID(s) field here refers the result of the CreateWorkItems procedure, you can use the comma-separated numeric values instead.

tr.td: ID(s) of the work item to delete.
Format to save the request results.
Deleted items will be saved into this property/property sheet.

p.p: Work Item ID(s) field here refers the result of the CreateWorkItems procedure, you can use the comma-separated numeric values instead.

div.p: To attach a file to a work item, upload the attachment to the attachment store, then attach it to the work item.

tr.td: The name of the file in the attachment store (typically the same as the name of the source of the attachment).
Path to the file to be uploaded. Either this field or "File Content" field must be specified.
File content to be uploaded. The value has a limit of 64KB. Either this field or "File Path" field must be specified.
Use chunked upload type for uploading large files (>130 MB).
Format to save the request results.
Result will be saved into this property/property sheet.

div.p: Get the default values that will be filled in automatically when you create a new work item of a specific type.
List of the predefined work item types can be changed in the plugin properties (Commander > Administration > Plugins > @PLUGIN_NAME@ > Properties tab > ecp_azuredevops_workitemtypes ).

tr.td: Name or ID of a team project where the work item type is defined.

Name of the work item type.
Example: Feature, Bug
Results will be saved into this property/property sheet.
Format to save the request results.
The ID or the name of the Build Definition.
The ID or the name of the queue. If not specified, the default queue for the definition will be used.
The branch to build. If not specified, the default branch for the definition will be used.

Parameters to pass to the build in key-value form, one pair per line. e.g. system.debug="true" BuildConfiguration="debug" BuildPlatform="x64". If not specified, the default variables for the definition will be used.
Results will be saved into this property/property sheet.
Format to save the request results.
ID or name of the team project.
ID or number of the build. Append * to do a number prefix search, but only latest build will be saved. Example: '20190110.1' or '26'
Name for the Build Definition. This parameter is required if you've specified Build number in a "Build Id or Number" parameter.
If checked, the procedure will poll the build status until the build is finished.
Timeout in seconds to wait for build to finish. Will be used if "Wait for build" is checked. Default is 300. Poll interval is set to 30 seconds, so this value should be multiple to 30.
Format to save the request results.
Results will be saved into this property/property sheet.

div.p:
AzureDevOps Services and some of the TFS Servers (default depends of the version), does not accept clear password for the Basic authentication method. You should create a Personal Access Token (PAT) and use it instead of a password.
Uploading Attachments in the "Chunked" mode when using NTLM authentication via proxied connection may fail if proxy server closes connection after a POST request without a response content.
